publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3016 Trish Godman: The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine-That the Parliament warmly commends the editor and staff of The Lifeboat, the magazine of the Royal National Lifeboat Institution (RNLI), on its 150th anniversary; believes that The Lifeboat plays an important role in informing its many readers of all elements of the lifeboat service, including detailed accounts of the numerous rescues carried out by the gallant lifeboat crews, fleet renewals, the fundraising activities of dedicated RNLI supporters and much more; remembers, too, the efforts of previous editors and staff of the magazine who ensured its survival during difficult years, including the two world wars, and, in particular, offers sincere thanks to the crews of the lifeboats whose bravery is so readily acknowledged in the pages of The Lifeboat and by those who live in our maritime communities.
S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Marilyn Livingstone*, Michael Matheson*

S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Michael Russell*, Iain Smith*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Mr David Davidson*, Scott Barrie*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Keith Harding*, David Mundell*, Rhoda Grant*, Shona Robison*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Mr John McAllion*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Karen Whitefield*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, John Young*

S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Colin Campbell*, Margaret Jamieson*, Johann Lamont*, Tommy Sheridan*, Tavish Scott*, Phil Gallie*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Fiona McLeod*

S1M-3016 Trish Godman: The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine-That the Parliament warmly commends the editor and staff of The Lifeboat, the magazine of the Royal National Lifeboat Institution (RNLI), on its 150th anniversary; believes that The Lifeboat plays an important role in informing its many readers of all elements of the lifeboat service, including detailed accounts of the numerous rescues carried out by the gallant lifeboat crews, fleet renewals, the fundraising activities of dedicated RNLI supporters and much more; remembers, too, the efforts of previous editors and staff of the magazine who ensured its survival during difficult years, including the two world wars, and, in particular, offers sincere thanks to the crews of the lifeboats whose bravery is so readily acknowledged in the pages of The Lifeboat and by those who live in our maritime communities. Supported by: Marilyn Livingstone, Michael Matheson, Michael Russell, Iain Smith, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr David Davidson, Scott Barrie, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Keith Harding, David Mundell, Rhoda Grant, Shona Robison, Mr John Home Robertson, Mr John McAllion, Brian Fitzpatrick, Karen Whitefield, Mr Kenneth Gibson, John Young, Colin Campbell, Margaret Jamieson, Johann Lamont, Tommy Sheridan, Tavish Scott, Phil Gallie, Dr Winnie Ewing, Fiona McLeod, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Andrew Wilson*, Ian Jenkins*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Susan Deacon*
S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Mary Scanlon*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Pauline McNeill*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Fiona Hyslop*, Alex Neil*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Karen Gillon*
S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Elaine Thomson*, Nora Radcliffe*, Janis Hughes*, Donald Gorrie*, Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Dr Sylvia Jackson*
S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Fergus Ewing*
S1M-3016 The 150th Anniversary of The Lifeboat Magazine (lodged on 22 April 2002) Elaine Smith*
